TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit OraclePermission extends System.Security.CodeAccessPermission implements class System.Security.Permissions.IUnrestrictedPermission
Public NotInheritable Class OraclePermission Inherits CodeAccessPermission Implements IUnrestrictedPermission
public ref class OraclePermission sealed : System::Security::CodeAccessPermission, System::Security::Permissions::IUnrestrictedPermission
type OraclePermission = class inherit CodeAccessPermission interface IUnrestrictedPermission

summary.span: 启用用于 Oracle 的 .NET Framework 数据提供程序，以帮助确保用户具有足够的安全级别来访问 Oracle 数据库。

span.span: Enables the .NET Framework Data Provider for Oracle to help ensure that a user has a security level adequate to access an Oracle database.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此类型已弃用，将.NET Framework 的未来版本中删除。This type is deprecated and will be removed in a future version of the .NET Framework. 有关详细信息，请参阅[Oracle 和 ADO.NET](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/oracle-and-adonet.md)。For more information, see [Oracle and ADO.NET](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/oracle-and-adonet.md). 属性优先于属性。The property takes precedence over the property. 因此，如果您设置到`false`，则还必须设置到`false`以防止用户使用空密码进行连接。Therefore, if you set to `false`, you must also set to `false` to prevent a user from making a connection using a blank password. 有关示例，演示了如何使用安全要求，请参阅[代码访问安全性和 ADO.NET](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/code-access-security.md)。For an example demonstrating how to use security demands, see [Code Access Security and ADO.NET](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/code-access-security.md).

summary.span: 获取一个值，该值指示是否允许使用空白密码。

span.span: Gets a value indicating whether a blank password is allowed.

value.span: 如果允许使用空白密码，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if a blank password is allowed, otherwise .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 枚举将优先于属性。The enumeration takes precedence over the property. 因此，如果您设置为 false，则还必须设置到`None`以防止用户使用空密码进行连接。Therefore, if you set to false, you must also set to `None` to prevent a user from making a connection using a blank password.
